newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Mt Leyshon 9 month profit A$15.1 mln.
newsitem.headline: Mt Leyshon 9 month profit A$15.1 mln.

text.p: Mt Leyshon Gold Mines Ltd on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit for the nine months to March 31 of A$15.1 million.
The unaudited profit for the third quarter was A$5.7 million, the company said in a statement.
Mt Leyshon, which is subject to a takeover offer from fellow gold miner St Barbara Mines Ltd, recorded a previous nine-month net profit of A$19.4 million.
Third quarter net profit last year was A$8.5 million.
Mt Leyshon said gold sales for the quarter were 54,836 ounces at an average realised price of A$587 an ounce, compared with an average spot price for the period of A$451 an ounce.
The total cash cost rose 10.1 percent on the previous quarter to A$327 an ounce due to a fall in mill feed grade, the company said.
Mt Leyshon, which is 75 percent owned by Normandy Mining Ltd, reiterated its opposition to St Barbara's bid.
"In particular, whilst exploration potential in the Meekatharra district is perceived to be excellent, the history of mining is characterised by low grade, high cost operations," it said.
The main asset of St Barbara, which has offered 32 of its shares for every 10 Mt Leyshon shares, is its Bluebird operation near Meekatharra in Western Australia.
Mt Leyshon also said it was aware of "the remaining significant surplus cashflow" forecast from the Mt Leyshon operation.
It was reviewing options including a return to shareholders though dividend payments, the development of another operation or the funding of additional exploration.
